Recommended: Wicked hood (start of quest).
Waterskins or an enchanted water tiara to survive the desert heat.
Completing the Crocodile Tears quest grants immunity against desert heat.
Amulet of glory for quick teleport to Karamja.

Start Point: Talk to Caelyn on the 2nd floor[US] of the house north of Edgeville bank.
Recommended: Three Varrock teleports or Varrock lodestone
Charged Amulet of glory, Wilderness Sword, or Edgeville lodestone

Start Point: Speak to Alfrick the Planner or Freya Lune at the Rellekka docks.
Requirements: Completed all of Otto Godblessed's Barbarian Training activities
Items Required: 875 coins to enter Brimhaven Dungeon, unless Karamja gloves 3 or Dungeoneering cape are owned
Recommended: 100 Combat or more is strongly recommended.
An Enchanted lyre to take you near quest start point in Rellekka (or Fremennik sea boots 4)
Either a charged ferocious ring, games necklace, Fairy rings BJQ (after restored) or a Slayer cape (to reach the Ancient Cavern)
Remora's necklace to teleport to the Grotworm Lair
A Hoardstalker ring or Dungeoneering cape to teleport to the Brimhaven Dungeon resource dungeon near the Abomination cave
A beast of burden to store food for the final fight
Enemies to Defeat: Bronze, iron, steel, mithril, or adamant dragon (depending on your combat level)

Start Point: Speak with Achietties at the entrance to the Heroes' Guild in Burthorpe.
Items Required: Ice gloves (can be obtained during the quest)
Fishing rod (can be obtained during the quest)
Fishing bait if baitless fishing is not unlocked (can be obtained during the quest)
For completing the quest solo: Multiple lockpicks in case of failure, or a hair clip

Either one (you may switch your gang): Black Arm Gang members: black full helm, platebody and platelegs (plateskirt will not work; trimmed armour versions also do not work); Phoenix Gang members: 1,000 coins or ring of charos (a)
For completing the quest with a partner: Black Arm Gang members: black full helm, platebody and platelegs (plateskirt will not work); Phoenix Gang members: Ranged or magic weapons
Recommended: Activated Burthorpe, Karamja , Taverley (or Catherby) and Varrock lodestone
A wicked hood with a consumed law talisman for faster access to Entrana
Dusty key (or level 70 Agility; can be obtained during quest; not required if fishing for lava eels in the Lava Maze) or a Mask of the Black Demon to teleport to Taverley Dungeon
Enemies to Defeat: Grip (level 22) (only if completing the quest with a partner and only if part of the Phoenix Gang; does not fight back)
Jailer (level 39) (to obtain the dusty key, if required)
Ice Queen (level 77) (to obtain the ice gloves, if not already found)

Recommended: Camelot teleport tablets
Amulet of glory
Wicked hood
Tokkul-Zo, for quick access to the Fairy ring network
Activated Draynor, Karamja, and Port Sarim lodestone

Start Point: Speak with Larrissa, who is outside of the Lighthouse, north of the Barbarian Outpost. Show on map
Items Required: For fixing the bridge: 60 steel nails
For fixing the bridge: 2 normal planks (can be obtained during the quest, just north of the fenced-in area of the Barbarian Outpost)
For fixing the lighthouse mechanism: Molten glass
For fixing the lighthouse mechanism: 1 swamp tar
For activating the wall: 1 Fire rune
For activating the wall: 1 Water rune
For activating the wall: 1 Earth rune
For activating the wall: 1 Air rune
For activating the wall: A sword of any type that you are willing to lose
For activating the wall: An arrow of any type (except ogre and training) you are willing to lose
Recommended: 43 Prayer
Ability to defeat a level 100 and level 84 monster, the second one being tricky.

A melee weapon (ideally a slash weapon), a ranged weapon (ideally thrown weapons), and magic weapon plus runes for all four elemental spells to switch amongst in combat. Necromancy does not work against the Dagannoth mother.
Games necklace and quick teleport tabs are very helpful to reach the Lighthouse during the quest.
Houses by Rellekka are also helpful transportation methods.
Lighthouse Teleport for quick teleportation to Larrissa

Start Point: Speak to Larry at Ardougne zoo. Show on map
Items Required: Clockwork suit (also known as penguin suit) or 1 silk, 1 plank and 1 clockwork to make one
Don't wear anything in the hand slot or cape slot
Recommended: Clocktower Teleport scrolls for quick access to Larry
Lunar staff or dramen staff for fairy ring teleport to the Snowy Hunter area (DKS), unless you have completed A Fairy Tale III - Battle at Ork's Rift.
Teleport runes to Ardougne and Yanille Watchtower Teleport or Ring of duelling to Castle Wars or Yanille tablet (from Love Story quest) are also useful.
Activated Fremennik Province lodestone
A way to recover run energy, such as resting, an Explorer ring, or (super) energy potions.
If As a First Resort is completed, the salt-water spring in the Oo'glog spa gives unlimited run energy for up to 24 minutes (the spa in the Anachronia base camp also works).
The Endurance Archaeology relic is another option.
It is recommended that you do not take armour or weapons as no combat is involved. Familiars are also not recommended as they cannot be taken into some of the quest areas.

Start Point: Talk to the wanderer, south-east of the southern bridge over the River Elid, in the desert far south of Al Kharid. Show on map
Items Required: A kitten, a cat, an overgrown cat, or a hellcat (it will only need to be out for seconds at a time, so food is unnecessary)
A pile of salt, bag of salt, salt shaker or an empty bucket to obtain a pile of salt
Recommended: High Agility to reduce chance of failing the pit jump
Weight-reducing clothing to preserve run energy
A few thousand coins to pay for magic carpets (Ring of charos (a) reduces fees)
Protection from desert heat and poison
Food in case of trap damage, being attacked and failing to jump the pit
Pollnivneach teleports, Pharaoh's sceptre, or some other method to travel to Sophanem
Ghostspeak amulet for optional dialogue and an achievement
Enemies to defeat: Apmeken apparition, Het apparition, Crondis apparition, or Scabaras apparition (levels 56-58)
Additional Info: Mummies (level 70) and Scarab swarms (level 12) are not required, but aggressive nonetheless.
